text: Willis Ludlow (January 24, 1854 - February 21, 1938) was an American farmer, banker, and politician. Born in Monroe, Wisconsin, Ludlow went to Milton College and University of Wisconsin. Ludlow was a farmer and was involved with the First National Bank. Ludlow served as mayor of Monroe in 1904 and 1906 and was a Democrat. In 1911, Ludlow served in the Wisconsin State Assembly.Wisconsin Blue Book 1911, Biographical Sketch of Willis Ludlow, p. 762. Ludlow died in Monroe, Wisconsin from injuries from a fall at his home,Death Takes Willis Ludlow of Monroe, Wisconsin State Journal, February 22, 1938, p. 2. leaving an estate worth $210,000. ==Notes== Category:1854 births Category:1938 deaths Category:People from Monroe, Wisconsin Category:Milton College alumni Category:University of Wisconsin-Madison alumni Category:Wisconsin Democrats Category:Mayors of places in Wisconsin Category:Members of the Wisconsin State Assembly
title: Willis Ludlow
